==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=叠|alt=曡,疉,畳,㬪,𣆹,𤴁}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|畾|宜}} – a pile.

Originally as {{zh-l|曡}}, with {{zh-l|晶}} on top. ''{{w|Shuowen}}'' commented that the shape change was promoted by emperor of the short-lived {{w|Xin Dynasty}}, who deemed the use of three "suns" ({{zh-l|*日}}) in this character too empowering - compared to three "fields" ({{zh-l|*田}}).

===Etymology===
Cognate with {{zh-l|褶|tr=-|lined dress}}, {{cog|bo|ལྟབ||to fold, gather up, to lay or put together}}, {{m|bo|ལྡེབ||to bend round or back, to turn round, to double down}}, {{m|bo|ལྡབ||to fold up, repeat, do again}}.

{{zh-hanzi}}
